page.title: 04OTMOOR
page.content: Otmoor is a flat boggy fenland of about 4 square miles.It is roughly 194 feet above sea level.Much of it is wet all the year with streams and ponds.It often floods in winter and this year was flooded a couple of foot deep in early June.It has many marshland flowers some of them are rare.There are also lots of rare butterflies.It is at the moment threatened by a motorway. There have been no proper roads across the moor since the Romans came. There are 7 villages round the moor but no villages on the moor itself. Some land near Beckley and Noke has been drained and is now farmed with crops. A few years ago there was a scheme to turn the moor into a reservoir but it was turned down.
